intro: Bupleurum canalense, commonly known as the Canary Island angelica, is a perennial herb native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Bupleurum canalense is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
